review: ***-1/2 stars!I love my Fire TV.  It's been great so far.  So getting this one was a no-brainer (got this at the early promo price.)  It works just like the Fire TV but here are my two issues.One, the wireless signal is not as strong as the Fire TV.  Even with a gigabit dual band wireless router, the reception is spotty in the upstairs bedroom (router in living room.)  Other blogs (not on this site) say the same thing.  So keep in mind that the Stick needs to be closer to your router (even with a gigabit dually).Two, this thing gets really hot.  My fear is that it will eventually burn out.  Worse case, cause a short and fire (no pun.)  I know my FTV gets hot too but not like the Stick.  So consider safety if using this on your wall-mount TV.Just a minor issue, I think it would be better to have the power port on both sides of the stick (if not opposite of where it is constructed now) because most HDTV have their HDMI ports on the left side (from screen perspective).  Older ones have the HDMI ports going perpendicular to the TV's (thanks of the flexible extender).  In any case, the power port (it has one but commercials don't tell you it has one) is up when inserted into my TV. Therefore, the power cable plugs on the upward side then has to hang down (which can tug on your stick).  Not a big deal.Other the than the two, it is comparable to the Fire TV.  I do not think these Sticks are meant to be long-use though.  Would recommend the FTV.
